searchDocs.title: Introduction to new centralized documentation
searchDocs.content: Dear colleagues, I trust this message finds you well. In our ongoing efforts to enhance communication and transparency between the business and development teams, I am pleased to announce the implementation of a new centralized documentation portal for the SoundScapeExplorer project. This portal serves as a comprehensive hub for all project-related documentation, updates, and other pertinent information. It is designed to function as a showcase for the platform, providing a convenient space to publish evolving documentation for upcoming versions while archiving the older ones. Additionally, it facilitates easy export of documentation in PDF format, enabling offline access for your convenience. I invite you to use and share the following link to others:sound-scape-explorer.github.io Your feedback on this initiative is highly valuable, and I encourage you to share any thoughts or suggestions you may have. Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to further advancing our collaboration through improved access to project information. Best regards, Bamdad

searchDocs.title: Announcing new version 12.0.0
searchDocs.content: ğŸ‰ Version 12.0.0 has been released! This new version introduces new generated relative trajectories data, numerous bug fixes and quality of life improvements. This major version bump has been motivated by the new installation procedure of Python dependencies. It also aligns with the complete rewrite of the documentation available on this portal. The main improvements available are the following: SSE Rewritten whole documentationImproved installation processAdded screencasts ğŸ“£ Campaign Added sse_fill helper for automatic file detectionaudio_path containing spaces on Windows are now fixed! ğŸ§® Processing Added relative trajectories generationImproved console feedbacks ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation Added relative trajectories interfaceImproved labels UXAdded PWA mode for easy offline accessVarious layout updates and bug fixes

searchDocs.title: Contextâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Use this command to extract the .xlsx configuration file from an existing.h5 storage file.  The extracted storage.h5-config-VERSION.xlsx is the actual configuration used to create the storage file.

searchDocs.title: Runâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open a shell window. (Double click start.bat on Windows or use cd on Ubuntu / macOS)Type sse_config followed by a <space>Drag and drop your .h5 storage file to the shell windowPress Enter  Example:  # Windows sse_config C:\to\storage.h5 # Ubuntu / macOS sse_config path/to/storage.h5

searchDocs.title: Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open the v11.10.0 release pageScroll to AssetsDownload the Source code (zip) fileExtract the downloaded archive (Extract here)Open the extracted folder sound-scape-explorer-VERSIONDouble click on start.bat. Wait for venv creation if neededEnter command pnpm iEnter command pnpm install:frontEnter command pnpm install:processing:windows. If you get an nvidia-*error, please use command pnpm install:processing:cpu:windowsClose the shellYou can now run a campaign

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open the v11.10.0 release pageScroll to AssetsDownload the Source code (zip) fileExtract the downloaded archive (Extract here)Open the extracted folder sound-scape-explorer-VERSIONOpen a new terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-VERSION. (You can also drag and drop the sound-scape-explorer-VERSION folder)Enter command python3.10 -m venv venvEnter command . venv/bin/activateEnter command pnpm iEnter command pnpm install:frontEnter command pnpm install:processing. If you get an nvidia-*error, please use command pnpm install:processing:cpuClose the terminalYou can now run a campaign

searchDocs.title: Installation procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Go to brew.sh and follow the instructions to install HomebrewOpen a terminalInstall external libraries:  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@16 pnpm   Update your $PATH:  echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@16/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'   You can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Xcode command line toolsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: If you encounter problems installing Homebrew, you need to install Xcode command line tools.  info To check if Xcode command line tools are installed, run: xcode-select -p   Open a terminalRun xcode-select --installContinue to Installing

searchDocs.title: Modulesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: There are 3 modules shipped with SSE:  Module	DescriptionProcessing	The actions responsible for processing your audio files. Front	The user interface running in the web browser. Audio	The web server to provide audio files in order to play them back in the browser.

searchDocs.content: Processing user guide  Visualisation user guide

searchDocs.title: Installation procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open a terminalInstall external libraries:  sudo apt install curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools -y   Install Python:  note Press Enter when you are prompted to add the apt repository  sudo apt install software-properties-common -y && \ sudo add-apt-repository ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv -y && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10   Update .bashrc:  sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/python python /usr/bin/python3.10 0 && \ echo "alias python=python3.10" >> ~/.bashrc && \ echo "alias pip=pip3" >> ~/.bashrc && \ source ~/.bashrc   Install Node.js:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_16.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install nodejs -y   Install pnpm:  sudo npm -g i pnpm   Close the terminalYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Installation procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win button on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new shell window)Navigate to chocolatey installation pageScroll to the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your shell windowPress Enter (Wait and type choco --version to verify installation)Install Python:  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y   info If you have a prior version of Python and want to uninstall it. Run the following command choco uninstall python3   Install Node.js:  choco install nodejs --version=16.20.0 -y   Install ffmpeg, curl and pnpm:  choco install ffmpeg curl pnpm -y   Close the shell window.Navigate to Microsft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (continue until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Tick Desktop development with C++Press Install (6 Gb of disk space will be used)Wait for completion, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools windowYou can now install SSE

searchDocs.title: Runâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open a shell window. (Double click start.bat on Windows or use cd on Ubuntu / macOS)Type sse followed by a <space>Drag and drop your Excel file to the shell windowPress Enter  Example:  # Windows sse D:\campaign\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS sse campaign/config.xlsx

searchDocs.title: Most frequent use caseâ€‹

When the menu displays again, the processing has completedYou can now go further to visualisation user guidein order to display your data

searchDocs.title: Export dataframe
searchDocs.content: Export dataframe Exports all intervals and associated data to a .csv file.

searchDocs.title: Export computation UMAPs command
searchDocs.content: Export computation UMAPs command Exports all computation UMAPs to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Export mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Export mean distances matrix Exports the mean distances matrix to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Refresh configuration
searchDocs.content: Refresh configuration Digest your Excel configuration file and copy all its information inside your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix Remove computation data from your storage file as it will not be consumed by the Front.

searchDocs.title: Quit
searchDocs.content: Quit danger You will not be able to read from your storage (visualisation) while it is opened by the Processing module. When the Processing module is running, your storage file is kept open thus not available to other programs to reading from it. Use this to properly close and release your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Repack storage
searchDocs.content: Repack storage warning This command is only available on UNIX systems at the moment. On Debian based distributions, install it with sudo apt install hdf5-tools When you overwrite a lot to your storage file, the space that was occupied by the deleted dataset is not immediately freed. This is due to how the HDF5 technology works. Repacking allows you to create a new file with your data but with the smallest possible size.

searchDocs.title: Run all
searchDocs.content: Run all Run all the commands necessary for a complete campaign.

searchDocs.title: Run autoclusters
searchDocs.content: Run autoclusters Automatically attribute numerical clusters (groups) of intervals that are related together depending on your settings. These clusters will appear in the Front as standard labels.

searchDocs.title: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix Run the necessary data for autoclusters to be performed. Those data will never be read in the Front so you can use the purge command to remove it from your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run digests
searchDocs.content: Run digests Take aggregated data and produce derived data using digesters algorithms.

searchDocs.title: Run reductions
searchDocs.content: Run reductions Take the aggregated data produced by neural networks and reduce them using your reducers settings.

searchDocs.title: Ubuntu / macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Copy the example folder new-campaign located in sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0/examples/campaignsRename the folder to whatever you wantOpen your campaign folder and edit the .xlsx configuration fileOpen a terminalType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-11.10.0Enter command . venv/bin/activateYou can now use SSE modules

searchDocs.title: Run extractions and aggregations
searchDocs.content: Run extractions and aggregations Extract data from your audio files either through neural networks or indicators algorithms. Take the raw data and aggregate them using your integration settings. tip These raw data can optionally be stored with the persist option.

searchDocs.title: Compatibilityâ€‹
searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we experienced random issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. Thus, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: sse_vis commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: sse_vis is only available if you have installed the Processingmodule.  This is the quickest command to start both Audio and Front modules.  On an active venv shell window, type the following to start both services (replace the path to your configuration file by drag and dropping the file Excel icon into your shell):  # Windows sse_vis C:\path\to\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS (venv)$> sse_vis /path/to/config.xlsx   After pressing <Enter>, both modules will start and your default browser will open.  Note You can also use sse_viz or viz as aliases to the sse_vis command.

searchDocs.title: audio:front commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: You can serve both Front and Audio modules at the same time  # Windows pnpm audio:front:windows Z:\audio_folder_example # Ubuntu / macOS pnpm audio:front relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: audio commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Serve Audio module on port 5531  pnpm audio -- relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: front commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Serve Front module on port 5530  pnpm front

searchDocs.title: Run trajectories
searchDocs.content: Run trajectories Compute the coordinates of the requested trajectories.

searchDocs.content: Remove computation data from your storage file as it will not be consumed by the Front.

searchDocs.title: Run autoclusters commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Automatically attribute numerical clusters (groups) of intervals that are related together depending on your settings.  These clusters will appear in the Front as standard labels.

searchDocs.title: Run trajectories commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Compute the coordinates of the requested trajectories.

searchDocs.title: Run digests commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Take aggregated data and produce derived data using digesters algorithms.

searchDocs.title: Run all commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Run all the commands necessary for a complete campaign.

searchDocs.title: Export dataframe commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Exports all intervals and associated data to a .csv file.

searchDocs.title: Export computation UMAPs commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Exports all computation UMAPs to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Export mean distances matrix commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Exports the mean distances matrix to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Repack storage commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: When you overwrite a lot to your storage file, the space that was occupied by the deleted dataset is not immediately freed. This is due to how the HDF5 technology works.  Repacking allows you to create a new file with your data but with the smallest possible size.  Note This command is only available on UNIX systems at the moment. On Debian based distributions, install it with sudo apt install hdf5-tools

searchDocs.title: Quit commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: When the Processing module is running, your storage file is kept open thus not available to other programs to reading from it.  Use this to properly close and release your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Compatibilityâ€‹
searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we experienced random issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. Thus, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: sse_vis commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: sse_vis is only available if you have installed the Processingmodule.  This is the quickest command to start both Audio and Front modules.  On an active venv shell window, type the following to start both services (replace the path to your configuration file by drag and dropping the file Excel icon into your shell):  # Windows sse_vis C:\path\to\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS (venv)$> sse_vis /path/to/config.xlsx   After pressing <Enter>, both modules will start and your default browser will open.  Note You can also use sse_viz or viz as aliases to the sse_vis command.

searchDocs.title: audio:front commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: You can serve both Front and Audio modules at the same time  # Windows pnpm audio:front:windows Z:\audio_folder_example # Ubuntu / macOS pnpm audio:front relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: audio commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Serve Audio module on port 5531  pnpm audio -- relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: front commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Serve Front module on port 5530  pnpm front

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘‹ Introductionâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Welcome to the official documentation for SoundScapeExplorer! This comprehensive guide is designed to help you navigate and harness the full potential ofSoundScapeExplorer. Whether you're new to SSE or a seasoned user looking for in-depth information, this documentation has everything you need to get started, optimize your workflow, and explore advanced features.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ¤” What is it for?â€‹
searchDocs.content: SSE is a powerful and versatile software environment designed for soundscape visualisation and quantification. It provides a robust platform for processing audio files, generating useful metrics, and presenting data through intuitive visualisation interfaces. Catering to bioacousticians and data scientists alike, SSE encompasses an extensive range of tools and capabilities to fulfil diverse user requirements.

searchDocs.title: ğŸƒ Getting Startedâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This documentation is your gateway to unlocking the potential ofSoundScapeExplorer. Here's what you can expect:  ğŸ—ºï¸ User-friendly Navigation: Explore SoundScapeExplorer's functionalities and features effortlessly.ğŸ—‚ï¸ Comprehensive Guides: Step-by-step instructions and detailed explanations to simplify your SSE journey.ğŸ’¡ Advanced Tips and Tricks: Optimise your workflow with expert-level tips and strategies.ğŸ¤ Community and Support: Engage with the SoundScapeExplorer community, seek assistance, and contribute to discussions.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”§ Installation
searchDocs.content: ğŸ”§ Installation The installation process is divided in two segments: ğŸ“‹ Requirements ğŸ’» Application

searchDocs.title: ğŸŒ Supported Operating Systemsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Refer to the following links for detailed instructions on installing requirements based on your operating system:   Windows Ubuntu macOS

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¥ Download ~125 MBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Download sound-scape-explorer-12.0.0.zip ~125 MBExtract the archive (use Extract here)Open the folder sound-scape-explorer-12.0.0Proceed to the next steps

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”® Virtual Environmentâ€‹
searchDocs.content: A virtual environment is established to manage Python dependencies.  It needs creation only once but can be activated multiple times.  tip You will need to repeat this step each time you open a new terminal session.

searchDocs.title: venv on  Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Double-click on start.bat and wait for venv creation and activation.   Windows screencast

searchDocs.title: venv on  Ubuntu /  macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open a new terminal sessionType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-12.0.0 folder  Create venvâ€‹  Execute the following command to create a virtual environment:  python3.10 -m venv venv   Activate venvâ€‹  Run this command to activate the virtual environment:  . venv/bin/activate    Ubuntu screencast

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§© Modules ~14 GBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Modules constitute the components of SSE and occupy approximately 14 GB of disk space.

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules sequentially using the following command:  pnpm i; pnpm install:front; pnpm install:processing:windows   tip Use right-click to paste in Windows terminals.  tip For accelerated processing with a compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda:windows

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Ubuntu /  macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules at once with this command:  pnpm i && \ pnpm install:front && \ pnpm install:processing   tip For accelerated processing with a compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the application and its dependencies, delete the sound-scape-explorer-12.0.0 folder.

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Proceed to the ğŸ§© Modules documentation.

searchDocs.title: C Compilerâ€‹
searchDocs.content: In order to install thehdbscan python package later on, a C compiler will be required.  You can install it on Windows through the Visual Studio Build Tools.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Navigate to Microsoft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (proceed until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Check the first box for Desktop development with C++Click on Install (requires 6 Gb of disk space) Wait for the installation to complete. Once done, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools window

searchDocs.title: Chocolateyâ€‹
searchDocs.content: We recommend using Chocolatey as a package manager to install the necessary requirements for the application on Windows.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new elevated terminal)Navigate to Chocolatey installation pageScroll to find the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your elevated terminalPress Enter to execute the command. Wait for the installation to finish.Keep the terminal open for subsequent steps

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: For Python installation, use the following command:  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Other Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install the additional dependencies required by the application:   Node.js pnpm curl ffmpeg  Use the command below to install these dependencies:  choco install nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open an elevated PowerShell window (as described in the Chocolatey section) and run the following command:  choco uninstall python3 nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Once completed, close your terminal and proceed to theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.title: Homebrewâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Using the package manager Homebrew is recommended to install the application requirements.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Navigate to brew.shFollow the installation instructions provided for HomebrewOpen a terminal to proceed with the next steps

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Execute the following command to install dependencies and update your path:   Python 3.10 Node.js pnpm C compiler curl ffmpeg  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm && \ echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@20/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'

searchDocs.title: Xcode Command Line Toolsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: info This step is optional. Additional context is needed.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open a terminal window and execute the following command:  brew uninstall gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Upon completion, close your terminal and proceed to theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.title: Oneliner ~500 MBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Execute this single command to automatically install all necessary system dependencies, consuming roughly 500 MB of storage:  /bin/bash <(wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sound-scape-explorer/sound-scape-explorer/v12.0.0/bin/requirements-ubuntu.sh)

searchDocs.title: System Update & Essential Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This section ensures your system is updated and equipped with useful dependencies:   curl ffmpeg HDF5 Tools  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt upgrade -y && \ sudo apt install -y gcc curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Python and related components:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y software-properties-common && \ sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install -y python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10

searchDocs.title: Node.jsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Node.js with the following command:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y nodejs

searchDocs.title: pnpmâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install pnpm with the following command:  sudo npm -g i pnpm

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open a terminal window and execute the following command:  sudo npm -g uninstall pnpm && \ sudo apt remove -y curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools nodejs python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt autoremove -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Upon completion, close your terminal and proceed with theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“£ Campaign
searchDocs.content: ğŸ“£ Campaign Creating a campaign is the first user step in using SoundScapeExplorer. A campaign enables the addition of audio files, label descriptions, and the definition of intervals and metrics. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¥ Downloadâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Download the default v12.0.0 configuration.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ  Localâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Go to sound-scape-explorer-12.0.0/examples/campaignsOpen the new-campaign folderDuplicate and modify the default config.xlsx

searchDocs.title: Excel configurationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: tip Paths referenced in the configuration are relative to this file.  tip You can automatically detect and add audio files.  The configuration is divided in multiple tabs:

searchDocs.title: Helpâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This tab provides quick information.

searchDocs.title: Settingsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your campaign settings in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Filesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify file paths, sites, dates, and labels in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Bandsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your filtering bands in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Integrationsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify integration intervals in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Rangesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify dates and time spans in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Trajectoriesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify trajectories in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Extractorsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure extraction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListExtractors tab for available extractors.

searchDocs.title: Digestersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure digesters (metrics) in this tab.  Refer to the ListDigesters tab for available digesters.

searchDocs.title: Reducersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure reduction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListReducers tab for available reducers.

searchDocs.title: Autoclustersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure autoclustering settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListAutoclusters tab for available autoclusters.

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: You can now generate your data using the ğŸ§® Processingmodule.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§® Processing
searchDocs.content: ğŸ§® Processing Written in Python 3, this module harnesses machine learning and a range of algorithms to extract valuable metrics from audio recordings. The generated data is stored in .h5 format, allowing seamless integration with the Visualisation module and enhancing data sharing among users. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: Export mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Export mean distances matrix This command exports the mean distances matrix to a .npy file.

searchDocs.title: Quit
searchDocs.content: Quit danger While the ğŸ§® Processing module is running, you storage file will be inaccessible for ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation. When the ğŸ§® Processing module is active, your storage file remains open, making it inaccessible to other programs for reading purposes. Use this command to correctly close and release your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Refresh configuration
searchDocs.content: Refresh configuration Digest your configuration file and copy all its information inside your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Repack storage
searchDocs.content: Repack storage warning Currently, this command is exclusively available on Ubuntu systems. When you frequently overwrite your storage file, the space previously occupied by the deleted dataset isn't immediately freed due to HDF5 technology's workings. Repacking enables the creation of a new file containing your data but optimized for the smallest possible size.

searchDocs.title: Run all
searchDocs.content: Run all This command executes all the necessary steps for a complete campaign.

searchDocs.title: Run autoclusters
searchDocs.content: Run autoclusters This process automatically assigns numerical clusters (groups) to related intervals based on your configuration settings. These clusters will be visible in Visualisation as standard labels.

searchDocs.title: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix This step initiates the required data required for performing autoclusters. As these data will not be accessed in ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation, you can utilise the Purge command to eliminate them from your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run extractions and aggregations
searchDocs.content: Run extractions and aggregations This step involves extracting data from your audio files using either neural networks or indicator algorithms. Once the raw data is obtained, it's aggregated based on your integration settings. tip Optionally, you can choose to store these raw data using the persist option.

searchDocs.title: Run digests
searchDocs.content: Run digests This stage involves taking aggregated data and generating derived data using digester algorithms.

searchDocs.title: Run relative trajectories
searchDocs.content: Run relative trajectories This step involves computing the paths of relative trajectories.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation
searchDocs.content: ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation Implemented in TypeScript using Vue 3, the ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation module provides an intuitive and interactive graphical interface. This web application operates locally, eliminating the need for an internet connection. Users can input storage files generated by the ğŸ§® Processing module. It offers a comprehensive set of features for visualising processed results, empowering researchers to gain insights and make data-driven decisions. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: Run reductions
searchDocs.content: Run reductions This stage involves taking the aggregated data generated by neural networks and reducing it based on your configuration reducers settings.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”— Compatibilityâ€‹
searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we've encountered intermittent issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. For optimal performance, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”§ sse_vis Commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: warning Ensure you have an active Python venv in a terminal window.  info Learn how to activate ğŸ”® virtual environments  This command swiftly initiates both the Audio and Front services.  In an active venv terminal, enter the following command to start both services (replace the path to your configuration file by dragging and dropping the configuration file icon into your terminal):  # Windows sse_vis C:\path\to\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS (venv)$> sse_vis /path/to/config.xlsx   After pressing <Enter>, both services will launch, and your default browser will open.  note You can alternatively use sse_viz as an alias for the sse_vis command. searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘‹ Introductionâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Welcome to the official documentation for SoundScapeExplorer! This comprehensive guide is designed to help you navigate and harness the full potential ofSoundScapeExplorer. Whether you're new to SSE or a seasoned user looking for in-depth information, this documentation has everything you need to get started, optimize your workflow, and explore advanced features.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ¤” What is it for?â€‹
searchDocs.content: SSE is a powerful and versatile software environment designed for soundscape visualisation and quantification. It provides a robust platform for processing audio files, generating useful metrics, and presenting data through intuitive visualisation interfaces. Catering to bioacousticians and data scientists alike, SSE encompasses an extensive range of tools and capabilities to fulfil diverse user requirements.

searchDocs.title: ğŸƒ Getting Startedâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This documentation is your gateway to unlocking the potential ofSoundScapeExplorer. Here's what you can expect:  ğŸ—ºï¸ User-friendly Navigation: Explore SoundScapeExplorer's functionalities and features effortlessly.ğŸ—‚ï¸ Comprehensive Guides: Step-by-step instructions and detailed explanations to simplify your SSE journey.ğŸ’¡ Advanced Tips and Tricks: Optimise your workflow with expert-level tips and strategies.ğŸ¤ Community and Support: Engage with the SoundScapeExplorer community, seek assistance, and contribute to discussions.

searchDocs.content: A virtual environment is established to manage Python dependencies.  It needs creation only once but can be activated multiple times.  tip You will need to repeat this step each time you open a new terminal session.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§© Modules ~14 GBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Modules constitute the components of SSE and occupy approximately 14 GB of disk space.

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules sequentially using the following command:  pnpm i; pnpm install:front; pnpm install:processing:windows   tip Use right-click to paste in Windows terminals.  tip For accelerated processing with a Nvidia compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda:windows

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Ubuntu /  macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules at once with this command:  pnpm i && \ pnpm install:front && \ pnpm install:processing   tip For accelerated processing with a Nvidia compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda

searchDocs.content: To remove the application and its dependencies, delete the sound-scape-explorer-12.1.0 folder.

searchDocs.content: Proceed to the ğŸ§© Modules documentation.

searchDocs.content: Navigate to brew.shFollow the installation instructions provided for HomebrewOpen a terminal to proceed with the next steps

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Execute the following command to install dependencies and update your path:   Python 3.10 Node.js pnpm C compiler curl ffmpeg  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm && \ echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@20/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'

searchDocs.title: C Compilerâ€‹
searchDocs.content: In order to install thehdbscan python package later on, a C compiler will be required.  You can install it on Windows through the Visual Studio Build Tools.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Navigate to Microsoft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (proceed until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Check the first box for Desktop development with C++Click on Install (requires 6 Gb of disk space) Wait for the installation to complete. Once done, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools window

searchDocs.title: Chocolateyâ€‹
searchDocs.content: We recommend using Chocolatey as a package manager to install the necessary requirements for the application on Windows.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new elevated terminal)Navigate to Chocolatey installation pageScroll to find the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your elevated terminalPress Enter to execute the command. Wait for the installation to finish.Keep the terminal open for subsequent steps

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: For Python installation, use the following command:  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Other Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install the additional dependencies required by the application:   Node.js pnpm curl ffmpeg  Use the command below to install these dependencies:  choco install nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Once completed, close your terminal and proceed to theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.title: System Update & Essential Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This section ensures your system is updated and equipped with useful dependencies:   curl ffmpeg HDF5 Tools  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt upgrade -y && \ sudo apt install -y gcc curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Python and related components:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y software-properties-common && \ sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install -y python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10

searchDocs.title: Node.jsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Node.js with the following command:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y nodejs

searchDocs.title: pnpmâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install pnpm with the following command:  sudo npm -g i pnpm

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open a terminal window and execute the following command:  sudo npm -g uninstall pnpm && \ sudo apt remove -y curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools nodejs python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt autoremove -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Upon completion, close your terminal and proceed with theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.content: ğŸ“£ Campaign Creating a campaign is the first user step in using SoundScapeExplorer. A campaign enables the addition of audio files, label descriptions, and the definition of intervals and metrics. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§® Processing
searchDocs.content: ğŸ§® Processing Written in Python 3, this module harnesses machine learning and a range of algorithms to extract valuable metrics from audio recordings. The generated data is stored in .h5 format, allowing seamless integration with the ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation module and enhancing data sharing among users. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: Excel configurationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: tip Paths referenced in the configuration are relative to this file.  tip You can automatically detect and add audio files.  tip Most column headers have documentation, available by hovering with mouse cursor.  The configuration is divided in multiple tabs:

searchDocs.title: Helpâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This tab provides quick information.

searchDocs.title: Settingsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your campaign settings in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Filesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify file paths, sites, dates, and labels in this tab.  tip Label properties must be prefixed with label_. We also recommend capitalizing them. Example: label_REPLICA

searchDocs.title: Bandsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your filtering bands in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Integrationsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify integration intervals in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Rangesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify dates and time spans in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Trajectoriesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify trajectories in this tab.  warning label_property and label_value are case-sensitive!

searchDocs.title: Extractorsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure extraction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListExtractors tab for available extractors.

searchDocs.title: Digestersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure digesters (metrics) in this tab.  Refer to the ListDigesters tab for available digesters.

searchDocs.title: Reducersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure reduction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListReducers tab for available reducers.

searchDocs.title: Autoclustersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure autoclustering settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListAutoclusters tab for available autoclusters.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘‰ Commandsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Refresh configurationRun extractions and aggregationsRun reductionsRun computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixPurge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixRun autoclustersRun trajectoriesRun relative trajectoriesRun digestsRun allExport dataframeExport computation UMAPsExport mean distances matrixRepack storageQuit

searchDocs.title: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix This action involves removing computation data from your storage file since it won't be consumed in ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation.

searchDocs.title: Run all
searchDocs.content: Run all This command executes all the necessary steps for a complete campaign.

searchDocs.title: Refresh configuration
searchDocs.content: Refresh configuration Digest your configuration file and copy all its information inside your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Repack storage
searchDocs.content: Repack storage warning Currently, this command is exclusively available on Ubuntu systems. When you frequently overwrite your storage file, the space previously occupied by the deleted dataset isn't immediately freed due to HDF5 technology's workings. Repacking enables the creation of a new file containing your data but optimized for the smallest possible size.

searchDocs.title: Run autoclusters
searchDocs.content: Run autoclusters This process automatically assigns numerical clusters (groups) to related intervals based on your configuration settings. These clusters will be visible in Visualisation as standard labels.

searchDocs.title: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix This step initiates the required data required for performing autoclusters. As these data will not be accessed in ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation, you can utilise the Purge command to eliminate them from your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run extractions and aggregations
searchDocs.content: Run extractions and aggregations This step involves extracting data from your audio files using either neural networks or indicator algorithms. Once the raw data is obtained, it's aggregated based on your integration settings. tip Optionally, you can choose to store these raw data using the persist option.

searchDocs.title: Run digests
searchDocs.content: Run digests This stage involves taking aggregated data and generating derived data using digester algorithms.

searchDocs.title: Run reductions
searchDocs.content: Run reductions This stage involves taking the aggregated data generated by neural networks and reducing it based on your configuration reducers settings.

searchDocs.title: Run trajectories
searchDocs.content: Run trajectories This step involves computing the coordinates of the requested trajectories.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation
searchDocs.content: ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation Implemented in TypeScript using Vue 3, the ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation module provides an intuitive and interactive graphical interface. This web application operates locally, eliminating the need for an internet connection. Users can input storage files generated by the ğŸ§®Processing module. It offers a comprehensive set of features for visualising processed results, empowering researchers to gain insights and make data-driven decisions. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: Run relative trajectories
searchDocs.content: Run relative trajectories This step involves computing the paths of relative trajectories.

searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we've encountered intermittent issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. For optimal performance, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘‹ Introductionâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Welcome to the official documentation for SoundScapeExplorer! This comprehensive guide is designed to help you navigate and harness the full potential ofSoundScapeExplorer. Whether you're new to SSE or a seasoned user looking for in-depth information, this documentation has everything you need to get started, optimize your workflow, and explore advanced features.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ¤” What is it for?â€‹
searchDocs.content: SSE is a powerful and versatile software environment designed for soundscape visualisation and quantification. It provides a robust platform for processing audio files, generating useful metrics, and presenting data through intuitive visualisation interfaces. Catering to bioacousticians and data scientists alike, SSE encompasses an extensive range of tools and capabilities to fulfil diverse user requirements.

searchDocs.title: ğŸƒ Getting Startedâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This documentation is your gateway to unlocking the potential ofSoundScapeExplorer. Here's what you can expect:  ğŸ—ºï¸ User-friendly Navigation: Explore SoundScapeExplorer's functionalities and features effortlessly.ğŸ—‚ï¸ Comprehensive Guides: Step-by-step instructions and detailed explanations to simplify your SSE journey.ğŸ’¡ Advanced Tips and Tricks: Optimise your workflow with expert-level tips and strategies.ğŸ¤ Community and Support: Engage with the SoundScapeExplorer community, seek assistance, and contribute to discussions.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“– How to Use This Documentationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: ğŸ” Search Function: Use keywords or phrases to quickly find what you need.ğŸšª Navigation Bar: Explore different sections and topics via the sidebar or navigation bar.ğŸ”µ Interactive Elements: Throughout the documentation, find interactive components for better understanding and navigation.

searchDocs.content: Type sse_config, then add <space>Drag and drop your storage file into the terminal (or type path)Press Enter

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”§ Installation
searchDocs.content: ğŸ”§ Installation info If you have already installed the requirements for the latest major version 12, you can directly skip to ğŸ’» Application installation. The installation process is divided in two segments: ğŸ“‹ Requirements ğŸ’» Application

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¥ Download ~125 MBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Download sound-scape-explorer-12.2.0.zip ~125 MBExtract the archive (use Extract here)Open the folder sound-scape-explorer-12.2.0Proceed to the next steps

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”® Virtual Environmentâ€‹
searchDocs.content: A virtual environment is established to manage Python dependencies.  It needs creation only once but can be activated multiple times.  tip You will need to repeat this step each time you open a new terminal session.

searchDocs.title: venv on  Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Double-click on start.bat and wait for venv creation and activation.   Windows screencast

searchDocs.title: venv on  Ubuntu /  macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open a new terminal sessionType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the sound-scape-explorer-12.2.0 folder  Create venvâ€‹  Execute the following command to create a virtual environment:  python3.10 -m venv venv   Activate venvâ€‹  Run this command to activate the virtual environment:  . venv/bin/activate    Ubuntu screencast

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§© Modules ~14 GBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Modules constitute the components of SSE and occupy approximately 14 GB of disk space.

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules sequentially using the following command:  pnpm i; pnpm install:front; pnpm install:processing:windows   tip Use right-click to paste in Windows terminals.  tip For accelerated processing with a Nvidia compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda:windows

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Ubuntu /  macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules at once with this command:  pnpm i && \ pnpm install:front && \ pnpm install:processing   tip For accelerated processing with a Nvidia compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the application and its dependencies, delete the sound-scape-explorer-12.2.0 folder.

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Proceed to the ğŸ§© Modules documentation.

searchDocs.title: C Compilerâ€‹
searchDocs.content: In order to install thehdbscan python package later on, a C compiler will be required.  You can install it on Windows through the Visual Studio Build Tools.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Navigate to Microsoft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (proceed until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Check the first box for Desktop development with C++Click on Install (requires 6 Gb of disk space) Wait for the installation to complete. Once done, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools window

searchDocs.title: Chocolateyâ€‹
searchDocs.content: We recommend using Chocolatey as a package manager to install the necessary requirements for the application on Windows.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new elevated terminal)Navigate to Chocolatey installation pageScroll to find the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your elevated terminalPress Enter to execute the command. Wait for the installation to finish.Keep the terminal open for subsequent steps

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: For Python installation, use the following command:  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Other Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install the additional dependencies required by the application:   Node.js pnpm curl ffmpeg  Use the command below to install these dependencies:  choco install nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open an elevated PowerShell window (as described in the Chocolatey section) and run the following command:  choco uninstall python3 nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Once completed, close your terminal and proceed to theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“š System recommendationsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Prior to installation, ensure that your computer meets the following requirements:  A minimum of 4 GB of RAM for optimal performance.A multi-core processor (2 cores or more) for efficient audio processing.About 15 GB of free disk space for installation of dependencies.Sufficient storage space for audio files and processed data.For optional accelerated audio processing, we advise using an NVIDIA GPU.

searchDocs.title: ğŸŒ Operating Systemsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Refer to the following links for detailed instructions on installing requirements based on your operating system:   Windows Ubuntu macOS

searchDocs.title: Homebrewâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Using the package manager Homebrew is recommended to install the application requirements.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Navigate to brew.shFollow the installation instructions provided for HomebrewOpen a terminal to proceed with the next steps

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Execute the following command to install dependencies and update your path:   Python 3.10 Node.js pnpm C compiler curl ffmpeg  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm && \ echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@20/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'

searchDocs.title: Xcode Command Line Toolsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: info This step is optional. Additional context is needed.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open a terminal window and execute the following command:  brew uninstall gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Upon completion, close your terminal and proceed to theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.title: Oneliner ~500 MBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Execute this single command to automatically install all necessary system dependencies, consuming roughly 500 MB of storage:  /bin/bash <(wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sound-scape-explorer/sound-scape-explorer/v12.2.0/bin/requirements-ubuntu.sh)

searchDocs.title: System Update & Essential Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This section ensures your system is updated and equipped with useful dependencies:   curl ffmpeg HDF5 Tools  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt upgrade -y && \ sudo apt install -y gcc curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Python and related components:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y software-properties-common && \ sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install -y python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10

searchDocs.title: Node.jsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Node.js with the following command:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y nodejs

searchDocs.title: pnpmâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install pnpm with the following command:  sudo npm -g i pnpm

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open a terminal window and execute the following command:  sudo npm -g uninstall pnpm && \ sudo apt remove -y curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools nodejs python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt autoremove -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Upon completion, close your terminal and proceed with theinstallation of SSE.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“£ Campaign
searchDocs.content: ğŸ“£ Campaign Creating a campaign is the first user step in using SoundScapeExplorer. A campaign enables the addition of audio files, label descriptions, and the definition of intervals and metrics. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¥ Downloadâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Download the default v12.2.0 configuration.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ  Localâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Go to sound-scape-explorer-12.2.0/examples/campaignsOpen the new-campaign folderDuplicate and modify the default config.xlsx

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§® Processing
searchDocs.content: ğŸ§® Processing Written in Python 3, this module harnesses machine learning and a range of algorithms to extract valuable metrics from audio recordings. The generated data is stored in .h5 format, allowing seamless integration with the ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation module and enhancing data sharing among users. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“‹ Requirementsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To generate data, ensure you have:  Ran the ğŸ”§ InstallationCompleted a configuration appropriatelyAn active Python venv in a terminal window  info Learn how to activate ğŸ”® virtual environments

searchDocs.title: ğŸš€ Executionâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Type sse followed by a <space>Type the path to your .xlsx file (or drag and drop file icon into the terminal)Press Enter   Windows screencast   Ubuntu screencast

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“ Examplesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: # Windows sse D:\campaign\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS sse campaign/config.xlsx

searchDocs.title: Excel configurationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: tip Paths referenced in the configuration are relative to this file.  tip You can automatically detect and add audio files.  tip Most column headers have documentation, available by hovering with mouse cursor.  The configuration is divided in multiple tabs:

searchDocs.title: Helpâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This tab provides quick information.

searchDocs.title: Settingsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your campaign settings in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Filesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify file paths, sites, dates, and labels in this tab.  tip Label properties must be prefixed with label_. We also recommend capitalizing them. Example: label_REPLICA

searchDocs.title: Bandsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your filtering bands in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Integrationsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify integration intervals in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Rangesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify dates and time spans in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Trajectoriesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify trajectories in this tab.  warning label_property and label_value are case-sensitive!

searchDocs.title: Extractorsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure extraction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListExtractors tab for available extractors.

searchDocs.title: Digestersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure digesters (metrics) in this tab.  Refer to the ListDigesters tab for available digesters.

searchDocs.title: Reducersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure reduction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListReducers tab for available reducers.

searchDocs.title: Autoclustersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure autoclustering settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListAutoclusters tab for available autoclusters.

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: You can now generate your data using the ğŸ§® Processingmodule.

searchDocs.content: Export computation UMAPs command This command exports all computation UMAPs to a .npy file.

searchDocs.content: Export dataframe This command exports all intervals and their associated data to a .csv file.

searchDocs.title: Export mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Export mean distances matrix This command exports the mean distances matrix to a .npy file.

searchDocs.content: Purge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix This action involves removing computation data from your storage file since it won't be consumed in ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“‹ Most Common Use Caseâ€‹
searchDocs.content: For executing all metrics specified in your configuration file:  Choose Run AllWait for processing completion. When the menu reappears, the processing has finishedTo visualise your data, select Quit, then proceed to the Visualisation User Guide

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘‰ Commandsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Refresh configurationRun extractions and aggregationsRun reductionsRun computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixPurge computation UMAPs and mean distances matrixRun autoclustersRun trajectoriesRun relative trajectoriesRun digestsRun allExport dataframeExport computation UMAPsExport mean distances matrixRepack storageQuit

searchDocs.title: Quit
searchDocs.content: Quit danger While the ğŸ§® Processing module is running, you storage file will be inaccessible for ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation. When the ğŸ§® Processing module is active, your storage file remains open, making it inaccessible to other programs for reading purposes. Use this command to correctly close and release your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Repack storage
searchDocs.content: Repack storage warning Currently, this command is exclusively available on Ubuntu systems. When you frequently overwrite your storage file, the space previously occupied by the deleted dataset isn't immediately freed due to HDF5 technology's workings. Repacking enables the creation of a new file containing your data but optimized for the smallest possible size.

searchDocs.title: Refresh configuration
searchDocs.content: Refresh configuration Digest your configuration file and copy all its information inside your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run all
searchDocs.content: Run all This command executes all the necessary steps for a complete campaign.

searchDocs.title: Run autoclusters
searchDocs.content: Run autoclusters This process automatically assigns numerical clusters (groups) to related intervals based on your configuration settings. These clusters will be visible in Visualisation as standard labels.

searchDocs.title: Run digests
searchDocs.content: Run digests This stage involves taking aggregated data and generating derived data using digester algorithms.

searchDocs.title: Run extractions and aggregations
searchDocs.content: Run extractions and aggregations This step involves extracting data from your audio files using either neural networks or indicator algorithms. Once the raw data is obtained, it's aggregated based on your integration settings. tip Optionally, you can choose to store these raw data using the persist option.

searchDocs.title: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix
searchDocs.content: Run computation UMAPs and mean distances matrix This step initiates the required data required for performing autoclusters. As these data will not be accessed in ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation, you can utilise the Purge command to eliminate them from your storage file.

searchDocs.title: Run reductions
searchDocs.content: Run reductions This stage involves taking the aggregated data generated by neural networks and reducing it based on your configuration reducers settings.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation
searchDocs.content: ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation Implemented in TypeScript using Vue 3, the ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation module provides an intuitive and interactive graphical interface. This web application operates locally, eliminating the need for an internet connection. Users can input storage files generated by the ğŸ§®Processing module. It offers a comprehensive set of features for visualising processed results, empowering researchers to gain insights and make data-driven decisions. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”— Compatibilityâ€‹
searchDocs.content: While the web app is compatible with most browsers, we've encountered intermittent issues with Firefox on Windows 11 and Safari on macOS 14. For optimal performance, we recommend using Chrome.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”§ sse_vis Commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: warning Ensure you have an active Python venv in a terminal window.  info Learn how to activate ğŸ”® virtual environments  This command swiftly initiates both the Audio and Front services.  In an active venv terminal, enter the following command to start both services (replace the path to your configuration file by dragging and dropping the configuration file icon into your terminal):  # Windows sse_vis C:\path\to\config.xlsx # Ubuntu / macOS (venv)$> sse_vis /path/to/config.xlsx   After pressing <Enter>, both services will launch, and your default browser will open.  note You can alternatively use sse_viz as an alias for the sse_vis command.   Windows screencast

searchDocs.content: Simultaneously start both the Front and Audio services.  pnpm audio:front relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”§ audio Commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Start the Audio service on port 5531.  pnpm audio -- relative/or/absolute/path/to/audio/folder

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”§ front Commandâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Start the Front service on port 5530.  pnpm front

searchDocs.title: ğŸ‘‹ Introductionâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Welcome to the official documentation for CoralSoundExplorer! This comprehensive guide is designed to help you navigate and harness the full potential of CoralSoundExplorer. Whether you're new to CSE or a seasoned user looking for in-depth information, this documentation has everything you need to get started, optimize your workflow, and explore advanced features.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ¤” What is it for?â€‹
searchDocs.content: CSE is a powerful and versatile software environment designed for soundscape visualisation and quantification. It provides a robust platform for processing audio files, generating useful metrics, and presenting data through intuitive visualisation interfaces. Catering to bioacousticians and data scientists alike, CSE encompasses an extensive range of tools and capabilities to fulfil diverse user requirements.

searchDocs.title: ğŸƒ Getting Startedâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This documentation is your gateway to unlocking the potential of CoralSoundExplorer. Here's what you can expect:  ğŸ—ºï¸ User-friendly Navigation: Explore CoralSoundExplorer's functionalities and features effortlessly.ğŸ—‚ï¸ Comprehensive Guides: Step-by-step instructions and detailed explanations to simplify your CSE journey.ğŸ’¡ Advanced Tips and Tricks: Optimise your workflow with expert-level tips and strategies.ğŸ¤ Community and Support: Engage with the CoralSoundExplorer community, seek assistance, and contribute to discussions.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”§ Installation
searchDocs.content: ğŸ”§ Installation info If you have already installed the requirements for the latest major version 1, you can directly skip to ğŸ’» Application installation. The installation process is divided in two segments: ğŸ“‹ Requirements ğŸ’» Application

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“š System recommendationsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Prior to installation, ensure that your computer meets the following requirements:  A minimum of 4 GB of RAM for optimal performance.A multi-core processor (2 cores or more) for efficient audio processing.About 15 GB of free disk space for installation of dependencies.Sufficient storage space for audio files and processed data.For optional accelerated audio processing, we advise using an NVIDIA GPU.

searchDocs.title: ğŸŒ Operating Systemsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Refer to the following links for detailed instructions on installing requirements based on your operating system:   Windows Ubuntu macOS

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¥ Download ~125 MBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Download coral-sound-explorer-1.0.14.zip ~125 MBExtract the archive (use Extract here)Open the folder coral-sound-explorer-1.0.14Proceed to the next steps

searchDocs.title: ğŸ”® Virtual Environmentâ€‹
searchDocs.content: A virtual environment is established to manage Python dependencies.  It needs creation only once but can be activated multiple times.  tip You will need to repeat this step each time you open a new terminal session.

searchDocs.title: venv on  Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Double-click on start.bat and wait for venv creation and activation.   Windows screencast

searchDocs.title: venv on  Ubuntu /  macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Open a new terminal sessionType cd followed by a <space> and the path to the coral-sound-explorer-1.0.14 folder  Create venvâ€‹  Execute the following command to create a virtual environment:  python3.10 -m venv venv   Activate venvâ€‹  Run this command to activate the virtual environment:  . venv/bin/activate    Ubuntu screencast

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§© Modules ~14 GBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Modules constitute the components of CSE and occupy approximately 14 GB of disk space.

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Windowsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules sequentially using the following command:  pnpm i; pnpm install:front; pnpm install:processing:windows   tip Use right-click to paste in Windows terminals.  tip For accelerated processing with a Nvidia compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda:windows

searchDocs.title: Modules on  Ubuntu /  macOSâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install all modules at once with this command:  pnpm i && \ pnpm install:front && \ pnpm install:processing   tip For accelerated processing with a Nvidia compatible GPU, include additional dependencies: pnpm install:processing:cuda

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the application and its dependencies, delete thecoral-sound-explorer-1.0.14 folder.

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Proceed to the ğŸ§© Modules documentation.

searchDocs.title: Homebrewâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Using the package manager Homebrew is recommended to install the application requirements.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Navigate to brew.shFollow the installation instructions provided for HomebrewOpen a terminal to proceed with the next steps

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Execute the following command to install dependencies and update your path:   Python 3.10 Node.js pnpm C compiler curl ffmpeg  brew install gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm && \ echo 'export PATH="/usr/local/opt/node@20/bin:$PATH" >> ~/.profile'

searchDocs.title: Xcode Command Line Toolsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: info This step is optional. Additional context is needed.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open a terminal window and execute the following command:  brew uninstall gcc curl ffmpeg python@3.10 node@20 pnpm

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Upon completion, close your terminal and proceed to theinstallation of CSE.

searchDocs.title: Oneliner ~500 MBâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Execute this single command to automatically install all necessary system dependencies, consuming roughly 500 MB of storage:  /bin/bash <(wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sound-scape-explorer/coral-sound-explorer/v1.0.14/bin/requirements-ubuntu.sh)

searchDocs.title: System Update & Essential Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This section ensures your system is updated and equipped with useful dependencies:   curl ffmpeg HDF5 Tools  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt upgrade -y && \ sudo apt install -y gcc curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Python and related components:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y software-properties-common && \ sudo add-apt-repository -y ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && \ sudo apt install -y python3.10 python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ curl -sS https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py | python3.10

searchDocs.title: Node.jsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install Node.js with the following command:  sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y ca-certificates curl gnupg && \ sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings && \ curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource-repo.gpg.key | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg] https://deb.nodesource.com/node_20.x nodistro main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt install -y nodejs

searchDocs.title: pnpmâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install pnpm with the following command:  sudo npm -g i pnpm

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open a terminal window and execute the following command:  sudo npm -g uninstall pnpm && \ sudo apt remove -y curl ffmpeg hdf5-tools nodejs python3.10-distutils python3.10-dev python3-pip python3.10-venv && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \ sudo rm /etc/apt/keyrings/nodesource.gpg && \ sudo apt update && \ sudo apt autoremove -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next Stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Upon completion, close your terminal and proceed with theinstallation of CSE.

searchDocs.title: C Compilerâ€‹
searchDocs.content: In order to install thehdbscan python package later on, a C compiler will be required.  You can install it on Windows through the Visual Studio Build Tools.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Navigate to Microsoft C++ Build ToolsClick on Download Build Tools to download the executableRun the executable (proceed until you get the menu Installing - Visual Studio Build Tools...)Check the first box for Desktop development with C++Click on Install (requires 6 Gb of disk space) Wait for the installation to complete. Once done, you can close the Visual Studio Build Tools window

searchDocs.title: Chocolateyâ€‹
searchDocs.content: We recommend using Chocolatey as a package manager to install the necessary requirements for the application on Windows.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ› ï¸ Procedureâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Click on the start menu (or press Win on your keyboard)Type PowerShellRight-click on the PowerShell iconSelect Run as Administrator (this will open a new elevated terminal)Navigate to Chocolatey installation pageScroll to find the installation commandCopy the commandPaste it in your elevated terminalPress Enter to execute the command. Wait for the installation to finish.Keep the terminal open for subsequent steps

searchDocs.title: Pythonâ€‹
searchDocs.content: For Python installation, use the following command:  choco install python3 --version=3.10.11 -y

searchDocs.title: ğŸ“¦ Other Dependenciesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Install the additional dependencies required by the application:   Node.js pnpm curl ffmpeg  Use the command below to install these dependencies:  choco install nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Uninstallationâ€‹
searchDocs.content: To remove the installed requirements, open an elevated PowerShell window (as described in the Chocolatey section) and run the following command:  choco uninstall python3 nodejs-lts pnpm curl ffmpeg -y

searchDocs.title: â­ï¸ Next stepâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Once completed, close your terminal and proceed to theinstallation of CSE.

searchDocs.title: ğŸ§® Processing
searchDocs.content: ğŸ§® Processing Written in Python 3, this module harnesses machine learning and a range of algorithms to extract valuable metrics from audio recordings. The generated data is stored in .h5 format, allowing seamless integration with the ğŸ‘ï¸â€ğŸ—¨ï¸ Visualisation module and enhancing data sharing among users. ğŸƒ Getting started ğŸ“– User Guide

searchDocs.content: tip Paths referenced in the configuration are relative to this file.  tip You can automatically detect and add audio files.  tip Most column headers have documentation, available by hovering with mouse cursor.  The configuration is divided in multiple tabs:

searchDocs.title: Helpâ€‹
searchDocs.content: This tab provides quick information.

searchDocs.title: Settingsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your campaign settings in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Filesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify file paths, sites, dates, and labels in this tab.  tip Label properties must be prefixed with label_. We also recommend capitalizing them. Example: label_REPLICA

searchDocs.title: Bandsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify your filtering bands in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Integrationsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify integration intervals in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Rangesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify dates and time spans in this tab.

searchDocs.title: Trajectoriesâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Specify trajectories in this tab.  warning label_property and label_value are case-sensitive!

searchDocs.title: Extractorsâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure extraction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListExtractors tab for available extractors.

searchDocs.title: Digestersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure digesters (metrics) in this tab.  Refer to the ListDigesters tab for available digesters.

searchDocs.title: Reducersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure reduction settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListReducers tab for available reducers.

searchDocs.title: Autoclustersâ€‹
searchDocs.content: Configure autoclustering settings in this tab.  Refer to the ListAutoclusters tab for available autoclusters.
